------=_NextPart_000_01A5_01D287DB.B7B2ED70
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="utf-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I have some questions about what kind of web sites Heretrix can harvest.  N=
one of the discussions I can find are all that specific.  

First, and most=
 important, I want to confirm that the End of Term project uses Heretrix, s=
o that what the End of Term nomination form can get is what Heretrix can ge=
t?   

Does Internet Archive also use Heretrix?

My actual concern is knowi=
ng what kinds of pages/ data can be sent to the End of Term project and Int=
ernet Archive to be preserved.

I understand that both efforts can harvest =
pages that are =E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D but not altogether clear what =
that means.

There is no comprehensive list of what file formats can be har=
vested.

Can doc and xls files linked from web pages be harvested?   Could =
I please have a list of preferably what formats can be harvested, or else a=
 list of what can=E2=80=99t.   

Can videos be harvested if there are direc=
t links to them, and under what circumstances?

Can Heretrix harvest You Tu=
be videos?   (there are usually direct links to view You Tube videos, but y=
ou need a tool that then presents a list of options to download.)

What can=
 be harvested from web pages that contain javascript?    I gather that Here=
trix can=E2=80=99t follow links that are contained in or linked by javascri=
pt?   Can they be harvested if they are linked by javascript and are contai=
ned in a local folder, as distinct from a different web site?   

Can pages=
 be harvested if images, such as jpg, on them are loaded by javascript from=
 a local folder?    What I=E2=80=99m told about that is outright contradict=
ory.   

Can gifs that contain multiple slides be harvested, like gifs that=
 play a series of images?

All of this matters because I=E2=80=99m working =
on EDGI=E2=80=99s project, they don=E2=80=99t have or can=E2=80=99t provide=
 complete instructions, and since they are harvesting uncrawlable web sites=
 that can not be submitted to the End of Term project, as a seeder, I need =
to know whether the page is =E2=80=9Ccrawlable=E2=80=9D.    

=E2=80=9CCraw=
lable=E2=80=9D means that Heretrix can harvest the page and whatever the li=
nks reach, not that a search engine could crawl it.   They may or may not h=
ave the same capacities.

Thanks a lot!

Yours,
Dora Smith
